content:
This example shows how to write a query that sorts its results.

Example

This example uses the following XML document: Sample XML File: Numerical Data (LINQ to XML). 

Dim root As XElement = XElement.Load("Data.xml")  
Dim prices As IEnumerable(Of Decimal) = _  
    From el In root.<Data> _  
    Let price = Convert.ToDecimal(el.<Price>.Value) _  
    Order By (price) _  
    Select price  
For Each el As Decimal In prices  
    Console.WriteLine(el)  
Next

This code produces the following output: 

0.99  
4.95  
6.99  
24.50  
29.00  
66.00  
89.99

Example

The following example shows the same query for XML that is in a namespace. For more information, see Working with XML Namespaces (Visual Basic).

This example uses the following XML document: Sample XML File: Numerical Data in a Namespace. 

Imports <xmlns='http://www.adatum.com'>  

Module Module1  
    Sub Main()  
        Dim root As XElement = XElement.Load("DataInNamespace.xml")  
        Dim prices As IEnumerable(Of Decimal) = _  
            From el In root.<Data> _  
            Let price = Convert.ToDecimal(el.<Price>.Value) _  
            Order By (price) _  
            Select price  
        For Each el As Decimal In prices  
            Console.WriteLine(el)  
        Next  
    End Sub  
End Module

This code produces the following output: 

0.99  
4.95  
6.99  
24.50  
29.00  
66.00  
89.99

See Also

Sorting Data
Basic Queries (LINQ to XML) (Visual Basic)
